website_summaries.verdict: Great deal on a two-pack from a well-known brand.
pros: Convenient no-mess formulation comes in a lipstick tube
Very fine exfoliator grains are gentle on lips
Slightly sweet smell is a nice addition
cons: Some users think the formula is too dry, but it helps to use on slightly wet lips

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: This is my second order of ELF Lip Exfoliator. It is COMPLETELY different than my first order, which I really liked. They are both hard, like plastic and do nothing. Of course, the seller does not accept returns, so more money down the drain. It's too bad we can no longer expect consistency when purchasing through Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Cherip

customer_reviews.title: Convenient, not messy, smells great, and leaves lips smooth!
customer_reviews.text: First time using tonight, but I already love it! More convenient and less messy then my lip exfoliator in the small tin. The directions say to wipe off the excess, but it exfoliates without leaving a ton of grit on your lips, so I didn’t feel the need to wipe them off, it just left them smooth and balmed. And it smells heavenly! Glad it came in a two pack!
customer_reviews.author: Ccalabr2

customer_reviews.title: smelly and waxy

I'm sorry but I wouldn't order this product again.

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I've used this before so I knew what i was expecting. It's simple and doesn't COMPLETELY rid my lips of flaky chapped skin but it does help a lot. The actual stick breaks off pretty easily though so it can make it annoying to use after the first few times. I try to remember to use this everyday (but often forget) and I do notice a difference, just don't expect a miracle if you usually have super chapped lips like I do! But it does feel nice afterwards. I think it's well worth it for the price still. Pictures show packaging, size, how it looks first opened & one after some uses.
